      • setVote

        public boolean setVote(long commentId,
                       Comment.Vote vote)
                throws BaringoApiException
        Sets the vote on the comment for the currently-authenticated user. For some reason this doesn't behave like the user interface; the best you can do is nullify your previous vote, not undo it; if your previous vote was "up" then downvoting it turns it to null. If you downvote again, nothing happens, whereas in the web UI, downvoting turns the result to an actual "down" the nex time you load the comment. Odd. ACCESS: AUTHENTICATED USER
        Parameters:
        commentId - - id of the comment to vote on
        vote - - vote up or down
        Returns:
        true if it worked
        Throws:
        BaringoApiException - - imgur didn't like that
